alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 6:54AM CDT until May 18 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road, Humble...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 141.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 144.3 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 138.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 151.0 feet on 08/28/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Lake Creek Sendera Ranch Roa 138.0 133.0 Sun 1 pm CDT 141.7 138.0 135.4 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM CDT.
